item.title: DQ Is Not Dairy Queen: Building My Own Data Quality Framework

When someone hears â€œDQ Framework,â€ I get asked if it comes with sprinkles. It doesnâ€™t. It comes with sanity-saving data validations, automatable quality checks, and opinionated constraints that donâ€™t melt under pressure.

So no, this isnâ€™t about Dairy Queen. But it does prevent frozen pipelines. â„ï¸

ðŸ’¡ Why I Built It

Every data engineer has been there:

  • A critical job runs on time… and writes garbage.
  • Downstream dashboards look suspiciously optimistic.
  • Stakeholders smile because they donâ€™t know 18% of yesterdayâ€™s rows are NULL.

I couldnâ€™t keep slapping WHERE col IS NOT NULL forever. So I built a reusable, testable Data Quality Framework ( DQF) and paired it with a Declarative Pipeline Assurance Tool (DPAT).

item.title: How I Cut Delivery Errors by 82% Without Losing My Sanity
item.description:
ðŸš¨ The Problem: Errors Everywhere

At my organization, we were shipping data pipelines faster than everâ€”but the delivery error rate stayed stubbornly around 12%, which meant:

  • ðŸ˜“ Manual rollbacks, dashboards showing stale or missing data
  • ðŸ‘Ž Frustrated teams notifying stakeholders (and me) daily
  • ðŸ•’ A few hours lost per incident, every day

It wasn’t sustainableâ€”and I’d had enough.

ðŸŽ¯ The Goal

Implement a self-healing pipeline with:

  • Automated quality gates
  • Full pipeline rollback on failure
  • Clear ownership via data contracts
  • Faster failed-job detection

And yes, keep my sanity intact.
